title: Drawing, Siloam and Jerusalem, Southeastern Corner of the Walls Seen from the Mount of Olives [Jerusalem,and Silwan, East Jerusalem, Israel], April 1868
title_raw: Siloam and Jerusalem, Southeastern Corner of the Walls Seen from the Mount of Olives [Jerusalem,and Silwan, East Jerusalem, Israel]
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at lower left corner:  Siloam & Jerusalem / April  / 68; at upper right: 2. grey  and orange brown /3. color of wall/4. grey white; numbered and inscribed throughout:  whitish / green /graves / pear / white / path
description:
Recto: Horizontal view of the countryside with boulders and gnarled olive trees on slopes, Siloam in the center middleground and the Dome of the Rock on the Mount Zion in the right background.

Verso:  an account

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Siloam and Jerusalem, Southeastern Corner of the Walls Seen from the Mount of Olives [Jerusalem,and Silwan, East Jerusalem, Israel], April 1868. Graphite on gray paper. 
Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-159
